message.content: A hendiadys (from the Greek, "joining of two words") is an expression in which two or more words are used together to create a single idea. It's a figure of speech that combines two or more words into one phrase, with the meaning being the sum of its parts. A common example is "give and take," which means both receiving something and giving something at the same time. Another example would be "too much of a good thing," meaning that having too much of something can be as harmful as not having enough.
